units.title: Pooling PSC lines before organoid generation
units.text: we pooled PSC lines (5,000 cells per line) before organoid generation
units.rationale: Describes the initial cell pooling step for mosaic organoid creation.

units.title: Downstream multiplexing by pooling dissociated cells
units.text: CBOs were generated individually from the PSC lines and pooled equal amounts of cells per line after organoid dissociation for single-cell library preparation
units.rationale: Specifies how cells are combined after dissociation for downstream multiplexing.

units.title: SCanSNP method design
units.text: we set out to develop a new method, SCanSNP (Fig. 3a), to overcome the observed limitations by (1) dividing the classification challenge into two steps, one for identity assignment and one for doublet detection and (2) measuring the genetic purity of each droplet to identify low-quality droplets and separate them from authentic doublets
units.rationale: Outlines the computational workflow for genotype assignment and doublet detection.

units.title: Consensus call framework for demultiplexing
units.text: we set a consensus call framework merging their outcomes into one combined output (Fig. 3b)
units.rationale: Combines results from multiple demultiplexing tools into a single decision.

units.title: Assessing proliferation via flow cytometry
units.text: we longitudinally assessed the proliferation rate of organoids derived from individual lines in two differentiation replicates through flow cytometry-based cell cycle analysis
units.rationale: Provides a quantitative measure of cell proliferation across lines.

units.title: Immunofluorescence validation of neurodevelopmental markers
units.text: We first characterized mCBOs by immunofluorescence for canonical markers of neurodevelopment previously defined for organoids and firmed their expected expression patterns (Fig. 2a,b)
units.rationale: Validates cell-type identity using established protein markers.

units.title: Longitudinal imaging and Census‑seq for line balance
units.text: In parallel, each mosaic combination was profiled by Census-seq integrating the longitudinal Census-seq with mCBO imaging data at five different time points in triplicate to measure the PSC line balance to model mCBO clonal dynamics
units.rationale: Tracks the contribution of each PSC line over time to assess scalability.

units.title: Trajectory reconstruction with PAGA and diffusion pseudotime
units.text: we leveraged partition-based graph abstraction (PAGA; dpt; Fig. 5c and Extended Data Fig. 6d) and isolated all biologically relevant lineages upon downsampling cells per genotype to ensure balance within each time point
units.rationale: Reconstructs developmental trajectories and ensures genotype balance.

units.title: Differential abundance testing with Milo
units.text: we tested for statistical significance in differential abundance of cell types across multiplexing modalities, leveraging Milo45, confirming significant differences across time points (Fig. 4c,d)
units.rationale: Identifies cell‑type composition changes between experimental conditions.

units.title: Monte Carlo simulation for scalability modeling
units.text: we modeled the scalability of the system, analyzing different multiplexing combinations with a Monte Carlo simulation with two initial parameters: (1) the starting number of PSC lines used to generate mCBOs and (2) the minimum number of cells per line required for single-cell analysis
units.rationale: Predicts how many lines and cells are needed for large‑scale studies.
